summary: Acetone, also known as 2-propanone, is a small, colorless, and flammable liquid with a strong smell. It is an important solvent used in industries, homes, and labs, and is found in products like nail polish remover and paint thinner. Globally, around 6.7 million tonnes were made in 2010. Acetone is also produced naturally in our bodies and can be found in blood and urine. People with diabetic ketoacidosis have higher levels of it. Additionally, acetone is used in special diets to help manage epilepsy in children.
title: Acetone
